c74object.name: fl.pow~
c74object.digest: Raises left input frame values to the power of right input frame values
c74object.description: Calculation is performed on pairs of values in turn. The output is a frame at least as long as the smaller of the two inputs. If inputs mismatch in length the result depends on the mismatch parameter. Either or both inputs may be set to trigger output.

entry.name: /mismatch [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
Sets the mode used when dealing with mismatched input lengths:
[0] - wrap - the smaller input is read modulo against the larger input.[1] - shrink - the output length is set to that of the smaller input.[2] - pad_in - the smaller input is padded prior to calculation to match the larger input.[3] - pad_out - the output is padded to match the length of the larger input.

entry.name: /trigger_ins [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
Sets which inputs trigger output.
[0] - both[1] - left[2] - right

entry.name: /pad [instantiation double]
entry.description: Sets the value used for padding (for either pad_in or pad_out modes).

objarg.name: default-input
objarg.digest: The input vector to use for any disconnected inputs
objarg.description: Values typed as arguments will be used as a vector for any inputs that are not connected. Either single values or multi-valued vectors can be entered. The behaviour is similar to that for arguments to standard objects such as +~, *~ or zl.reg.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.pow~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.pow~. When set to 0 fl.pow~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.pow~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
